answers.answer: PACs and PVCs are premature beats that occur from the top and bottom chambers of the heart. As long as your heart is otherwise healthy they are not associated with bad outcomes. Because you are a diabetic and have PVC's I would look into an evaluation for coronary artery disease unless you have already done that (stress test)

question: i have type 2 diabetes and seem to be having palpitations when my sugar gets low and after i eat, also some tachy- i am wondering if this could be related to the release of insulin in my body and how that whole process works to cause the palps, my doctors all say i am having pvcs and pacs and tachy but insulin can not cause that...i have really been paying attention and think it is connected, any info would be helpful !
title: insulin associated with palpitations??
